author: markbrus88
title: Arsenal fans raise over ÂŁ2000 in crowdfunder to force Arsene Wenger out
text:
Imagine the world we’d have if Arsenal fans focused their energy elsewhere (Picture: Getty) Arsenal fans have contributed ÂŁ2000 and counting towards a crowdfunder for a campaign to force manager Arsene Wenger out of the club.
The Frenchman, who has been at the club for over 20 years in one of the most successful periods in their history, has become increasingly unpopular after a lack of major silverware since 2004.
Video: Jose Mourinho silences Chelsea fans with PERFECT response during Man Utd clash Arsenal fans marched in protest at Wenger and the club’s board before Saturday’s FA Cup win over Lincoln City, which saw them reach the semi-finals of the competition for the third time in the last four seasons.
Still, Gooners clearly feel this is a cause worth donating to, with a ÂŁ3000 target to help fund the Wenger Out campaign already 69% towards its target.
Arsenal fans haveÂ a hard life… (Picture: JustGiving) The JustGiving page has been up for four days and clearly has a great deal of support, though it’s hard to know how much influence a supporter-led campaign can really have at this point.
Wenger’s contract is up in the summer and he has hinted himself that he could take on board the mood among the fans when deciding whether or not to extend his deal.
Arsene Wenger has won 27% of all of trophies in Arsenal’s historyÂ (Picture: Getty) Arsenal fans are determined to get rid of their manager (Picture: Getty) More: Football True Gooner! Arsenal new-boy aims dig at Chelsea after ditching Blues for Gunners 
Chelsea star talks up team-mate's move to Real Madrid 
Arsenal meet with Champions League giants over ÂŁ35m transfer move for speedster 
Arsenal fixtures West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar
Manchester City (H) – Sun 2 Apr
West Ham (H) – Wed 5Â Apr
Crystal Palace (A) – Mon 10 Apr
Middlesbrough (A) – Mon 17 apr
Sunderland (H) – Sat 22 Apr
Tottenham (A) – Sun 30 Apr
Juventus manager Massimiliano Allegri has been strongly linked as Arsenal’s first choice to replace the former Monaco boss if he does decide to step down.
A definition of the campaign from Chris Butler reads: ‘We are raising funds to help with demonstrations, advertisements and banners to encourage the owners of Arsenal, to remove Arsene Wenger from the position of manager. He has constantly delivered unsatisfactory results, and lifelong Gooners are fed up.’
Click here to see donate to more worthwhile JustGiving causes , if you happen to thinkÂ removing a manager who consistently finishes in the top four in probably the hardest league in the world whilst also winning the odd cup here and there isn’t the best use of ÂŁ3000.
